ygData.subject: Re: research item on lvl 16+
ygData.msgSnippet: Easiest way to find out is con players.  And have them con the beast. (when in a group). Then you can start to figure out the level differences. Vumar ...
ygData.messageBody:
Easiest way to find out is con players. And have them con the beast. (when
in a group). Then you can start to figure out the level differences.

Vumar
----- Original Message -----
From: Keith Wiseman <keithw@...>
To: <EQ_spell_research@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, June 29, 1999 12:12 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ_spell_research] research item on lvl 16+


> From: Keith Wiseman <keithw@...>
>
> Well, this changes throughout the levels...
> At Lvl 1, your statement would not be true, without question 2 levels
higher
> would be Red...
> As you move up the levels, the range increases. I'm sure someday we'll
see
> a nice chart on how the spread increases but for now just know that it
does.
> You can usually get a 'feel' for it as you continue to con the same old
> beasts as you are leveling. I can't remember for sure, but I do remember
> feeling that at Lvl 13, anything 3 levels above was Red.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: yur@... [mailto:yur@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, June 29, 1999 10:40 AM
> To: eq_spell_research@onelist.com
> Subject: [EQ_spell_research] research item on lvl 16+
>
> From: yur@...
>
> The Yellow con does not mean 1 lvl higher. it can be a max of 4 lvl
higher.
> above 5 lvl higher is a red
